title: Blitzcrank pull nullified by ezreal arcane shift.
body:
I was playing blitzcrank support against an ezreal. There is a delay between casting and the teleportation, unlike with flash. If he casts it but does not finish it, it will not be interupted by blitzcranks q, and he will be transported to the desired location, be stunned momentarily, but be otherwise unharmed, other than the damage.

He is not pulled in.

replies.body: This is working as intended. :)

Wrong.

It's a bug that nobody at Riot ever decided to fix.

Just like Ahri's Charm being able to stop dashes or Darius' Apprehend being able to pull people after they got out of the range were a thing for over 4 years.
They fixed both your examples. And as a guy who loves to play Blitz every now and again, it may be frustrating to play against but it is certainly intended from everything I can tell.

I disagree that it was intended. It makes no logical sense to occur. It's a ridiculous mechanic that necessarily gives an Ezreal player an advantage. Given his current level of popularity, it's actually an ideal time to fix this long-ignored issue.

To the point - I'm practically certain that Riot did not release Ezreal with the thought that his shift would work this way. It was something that just happened to occur due to how things were programmed, and over time Riot decided that they "liked it". Perhaps because a lot of ADCs hate on Blitzcrank and leaving them with a champion that could effectively ignore his main ability was a better solution than removing or unfairly nerfing the champion. Who knows. It seems very unlikely that Riot made Ezreal with this mechanic "intended" though. Much more likely that it was an accident that they've just happened to support.

Exactly like Ahri's charm. It was an accident, as should now be obvious since they "fixed" it. They only fixed it though, because people started complaining about how strong Ahri was. In actuality, the mechanic was fine and was something pretty neat and unique about her and that's probably why it stuck for so long. 

Just my 2 cents at least. This is not intended, it's just something Riot has chosen to accept as part of normal gameplay. It's no different than saying that AFKs are intended, they aren't - but the fact that you don't get loss prevented when you have one is normal and acceptable gameplay (as you still get a win when enemies have one, and introducing loss prevented or mercy on AFKs would introduce a slew of other problems - although I don't want to thread hijack so I won't get further in to that).

it is intended most likely because if it worked the way you think it should, a slower reaction on arcane shift would actually be rewarded compared to a faster one where you get hooked at the same time. ezreal's e isn't stopped by anything other than death once it's cast. you're just gonna have to get over it lol

I'd say just the opposite.

Currently the speed that results in this mechanic requires the ezreal player casting before the hook hits. If it were an instant cast without the reaction, he'd outright dodge the hook (however, the blitz player would have the ability to predict the blink and still hit the hook, which in my opinion is desirable counterplay). 

A slower speed would result in him being hooked, and unable to cast the ability while being dragged in. He could blink after the hook (potentially dodging the knockup) but would not be able to exit the hook displacement unless he first used cleanse/QSS before applying his blink (as one can currently do with flash).

Sounds awful

I think they are not channeled ability, the only have long cast time and animation and for what i understand when a cast is started they action can't best stopped so if the game is coded like that then the game is working, maybe is misunderstanding some part but for i can understand the game work that way.

I assume english isn't your primary language(or even secondary) since you completely missed the point of my comment.

Karthus' ult, Tahm Kench's ult, Rek'Sai's ult etc. are channels. Silences, stuns, fears, knock-abouts, charms, taunts will stop them and in case of Tahm and Rek also taking damage does it.

---

There is no practical reason for Ezreal and Lux's ults to not be channels.
They should be used at long range and casting them in melee range should be punishable. It's not.

---

On the other hand there is Ezreal's Arcane Shift.
If we break it down, this is what happens visually:
Ezreal creates a portal in front of himself, then proceeds to jump into it and get teleported. The time he begins creating a portal and jumping into it is the "cast time".
Except if somebody knocks him out of the jump and away from the portal, why should he still get through it?

Thematically, it's plain stupid.
Gameplay-wise, it's plain stupid too.
